titleStmt.title: Couragious Jemmy's resolution. Or, An answer to coy Jenny's reply. You maidens fair of beauty bright, I pray attend and mind; you may be crowned with delight, if you are not unkind. To the tune of, Jenny tell me roundly.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon, at the sign of the Angel in Guiltspur-street, without Newgate,

notesStmt.note: Date and place of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Verse: "Jenny when I was most loyal,".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the sign of the Angel in Guiltspur-street, without Newgate
